description:
Hyaloperonospora arabidopsidis Emoy2 is a plant pathogenic oomycete that infects the model plant species Arabidopsis thaliana. It is an obligate biotrophic parasite, meaning it can only grow and reproduce on living host plant cells.

The Emoy2 strain is a specific isolate of H. arabidopsidis that has been extensively studied as it interacts with the Arabidopsis immune system. The oomycete produces specialized feeding structures called haustoria that penetrate the host plant cells, allowing it to extract nutrients while avoiding complete host cell death.

H. arabidopsidis Emoy2 has a diploid life cycle and undergoes asexual reproduction through the production of spore-like structures called sporangia. These sporangia can be dispersed by wind or water to initiate new infections in Arabidopsis plants.

As a model pathosystem, the interaction between H. arabidopsidis Emoy2 and Arabidopsis has provided important insights into the molecular mechanisms of plant-oomycete interactions and the evolution of plant immunity.
